message: Can't wait for the episode to post
This weeks guest Stephen Wolfram just made my head explode! Most of what he was talking about went over my head, but I was completely fascinated with the discussion.

Oh MAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The Bob Heil interview was beyond awesome. The stories he told in that short time. All the bands he's worked with from the 60's up till the 80's. The Who, The Graetful Dead, Janis Jopliin, Frampton the list goes on. Don't miss this episode when it's posted.
Bob Heil built Pete Townsends guitars, yes, from The Who, the ones that Townsend smashed during the concerts. OMG, cringe.
He also "gave" the first talk-box (a Bob Heil model, btw) to Peter's wife to give as a present to Peter. Bob also plays the organ amazingly well.
the audio engineer in me loved the bob heil interview love to see more
Interview with Bob Heil was good and Leo really got into it.

You know who would be a great guest: Leo Laporte. 

When he was on his trip there was a great, between show moment, with Tom and Sarah and maybe someone else where they were talking about Leo as a pioneer in internet TV. I would like to have Tom interview Leo, I think what he is doing with TWiT is fascinating. The way he puts everything on the air is incredible too, watching him woo Jerri to come to TWiT was great TV.
@richardya spot on!
Twit in a way IS an episode of Triangulation interview with Leo, just keep watching the live stream. Its why I watch the live stream more that the downloads.
That does sound like a good idea. Leo is a pioneer. There is nothing else like TWiT.
If Leo was to be the "Guest" on Triangulation, I would like to see an outsider to interview him. Tom would still be part of it, but add someone like Kevin Rose as one on the interviewers.
Has to be 2 outsiders. It takes 3 to triangulate.
Kevin's pretty close as well but he's a great interviewer. Of course Tom is a great interviewer.
I left Tom in the mix, so there is still three.
I think Jeri Ellsworth would be perfect to do this. She's not a TWiT altough Leo wants her to be.
I see. It is on Rev3. I'm watching Jack Dorsey now.
Kevin came to mind, due to his new Foundation Series. Plus it would easier with a friend.
I have not seen the Foundation Series. Is that on Rev3?

Tom could do it better than anyone. As much as I personally love messing with the hosts in IRC, it is overlooked how incredibly talented that guy is.

Anyway, if there was a way to search Justin.TV I would love to link the conversation that Tom and a few others had regarding Leo & TWiT. It was amazing and showed that the other people on the network are keenly aware of the import of what they are doing in the media industry.

I never noticed before that the "Triangulation" title had something to do with "3" people on the show. Who would be a good third person? Hmm maybe Jeff Jarvis in studio.
@richardya When was that conversation? (and how did you get your small funky fonts in that message :)
I think it was pre or post TNT on one of the days Leo was on the cruise. I get the font when I copy/paste sometimes but I don't like it.
Do you type the text somewhere else and then paste it in? Perhaps it just copies that formating :)
@HateBadDesign i think convore sees pasted text as code, hence the monospace and optional wrapping...
Well, if you copy text from most editors that will include control characters, unless you use notepad or something similar which doesn't use control characters (like this)
hi
@ljsworld wonder what we would discover if Woz (Steve Wozniak) interviewed Leo .. would be interesting to hear much history from a pioneer and a journalist / pioneer of new media
Woz may not have the interviewing skills of Tom or Jeff Jarvis.
Steve Jobs and Jason Calcanis interviewing Leo ;)
Arrington + Calacanis! :)
@timo Except it would be hard to tie Leo to a ball ;)
@HateBadDesign so true ;)
Imagine Leo interviewing Albert Einstein!!!!!
Or Bill gates!!!!
Or Steve Jobs!!!!!
Or Steve Buscemi!!
WHAT ABOUT HIMSELF?!?!?!?!!!!???!!!!!!
He interviews himself everday.
He interviews himself everyday.
